item.content:encoded:
We are THRILLED to report that all signs are pointing to YES!

At least according to Jean-Baptiste, who co-penned Britney Spears' smash with will.i.am, Scream & Shout, and is currently hard at work on the pop sensation's eighth studio album!

The writer took to Twitter to praise the Black Eyed Peas member for the contributions he's made to Brit Brit's tracklist, and then dropped some pretty exciting news about the potential Wiz Khalifa collaboration:

This @britneyspears album is gonna be album to be inspired by,and also the most thrillest and most grammyist!!!

— Jean Baptiste Kouame (@LordMasterJeanB) April 8, 2013

That nigga @iamwill isn't playing fair with these new @britneyspears records.I gotta step it up

— Jean Baptiste Kouame (@LordMasterJeanB) April 12, 2013

@wizkhalifa Yo!!!! Can a nigga get that Britney verse bruh?

— Jean Baptiste Kouame (@LordMasterJeanB) April 12, 2013

Oh MAN! This is some SERIOUSLY exciting sh-t!

But don't go too hard on Wiz, Jean!

He IS a new father, after all! He's probably all sorts of busy!

That being said, HURRY IT UP!

We are in DIRE need of new Brit Brit! And when you make it sound as good as this, our impatience only GROWS!

What do U think?? Are U excited for potential Britney Spears tunes featuring Wiz Khalifa?!

P.P.S. CLICK HERE to "like" Perez on Facebook!

Rebel Wilson not only brought some HIGHlarious stints to the Sony Pictures Studios stage, but she was also one of the BIGGEST winners of the evening, along with Jamie Foxx and Bradley Cooper.

Ch-ch-check out the rest of MTV's honorees...AFTER THE JUMP!!!

Robert Downey Jr., Scarlett Johansson, Mark Ruffalo, Chris Evans and Jeremy Renner in Marvel’s The Avengers

TRAILBLAZER

Emma Watson

BEST KISS

Jennifer Lawrence & Bradley Cooper, Silver Linings Playbook

COMEDIC GENIUS

Will Ferrell

BREAKTHROUGH PERFORMANCE

Rebel Wilson, Pitch Perfect

Taylor Lautner, The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn Part 2

Bilbo Baggins, The Hobbit

Anna Kendrick, Rebel Wilson, Anna Camp, Brittany Snow, Alexis Knapp, Ester Dean and Hana Mae Lee,
Pitch Perfect

item.title: Brad Pitt Gives The Avengers Movie Of The Year At The 2013 MTV Movie Awards!
item.dc:creator: Perez Hilton
item.description: It was the moment we all were waiting for! Brad Pitt! Ch-ch-check out the video (above) to see the World War Z star wrap up the MTV Movie Awards by presenting the Movie of the Year Award! The Avengers was the big winner of the night, taking home the trophy for Movie of the Year! The super-sized action [...]
item.content:encoded:
It was the moment we all were waiting for!

Brad Pitt!

Ch-ch-check out the video (above) to see the World War Z star wrap up the MTV Movie Awards by presenting the Movie of the Year Award!

The Avengers was the big winner of the night, taking home the trophy for Movie of the Year! The super-sized action flick had an all star cast featuring Robert Downey Jr., Chris Evans, Mark Ruffalo, Chris Hemsworth, Scarlett Johansson, Jeremy Renner, Samuel L. Jackson, and Gwyneth Paltrow.

Like we need to tell you! Who didn't see The Avengers?

No wonder it was able to beat out such stiff competition as The Dark Knight RisesDjango Unchained, Silver Linings Playbook, and Ted!

After an Awkward intro by Ashley Rickards, Rebel's costars Anna Camp, Brittany Snow, Alexis Knapp, Ester Dean and Hana Mae Lee took the stage along with their leading lady to claim their much deserved prize!

Ch-ch-check out their acceptance speech (above)!

Way to go ladies! You totally deserve it!

item.content:encoded:
Even if he might've lost to the good guys in The Avengers, Loki is a winner tonight!!!

Tom Hiddleston demolished his evil competition for Best Villain at the MTV Movie Awards 2013!!

The wickedly good looking actor speared his fellow nominees, including Javier Bardem in Skyfall, Leonardo DiCaprio in Django Unchained, Marion Cotillard in The Dark Knight Rises, and Tom Hardy in The Dark Knight Rises.

Besides those studly horns, we're sure the fact that One Direction's Liam Payne named his dog Loki is what inched him over the edge! LOLz!!

Congrats, Tom!

item.title: Martin Freeman Swoops In And Wins Best Hero At MTV Movie Awards!
item.dc:creator: Perez Hilton
item.description: Cue the heroic music! Martin Freeman won over the fans and took home the trophy for Best Hero at the MTV Movie Awards for his SUPER performance as Bilbo Baggins in The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey! It was a bit of an upset considering he was up against Christian Bale, Mark Ruffalo, Robert Downey Jr., and Anne [...]
item.content:encoded:
Cue the heroic music!

Martin Freeman won over the fans and took home the trophy for Best Hero at the MTV Movie Awards for his SUPER performance as Bilbo Baggins in The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey!

It was a bit of an upset considering he was up against Christian Bale, Mark Ruffalo, Robert Downey Jr., and Anne Hathaway in a STACKED field, but the voters went with the little dude!

Who knew such a small guy would be able to take down Batman, The Hulk, Iron Man, AND Catwoman??! Pretty impressive for a hobbit!

Way to go, Bilbo!

[Image via Warner Bros..]
